metadata.title: Technological Challenges and Future Prospects of Human Space Travel

abstract.text: Human space travel presents significant engineering, biological, and logistical challenges. This paper reviews propulsion systems, life-support technologies, and mission planning strategies.

body_text.text: Space missions require reliable propulsion, radiation shielding, and sustainable life-support systems to ensure astronaut safety.
We analyze chemical, electric, and nuclear propulsion methods for long-duration missions.
Results suggest that hybrid propulsion and closed-loop life-support systems are essential for future interplanetary travel.
